faq.java-rotation: Minecraft Block/Item model rotations are limited by the format to one axis at a time and increments of 22.5°.
faq.java-culling:
Minecraft hides (culls) the faces between solid blocks to improve performance. To avoid this, remodel a non-solid block. For example: Glass, Pressure Plates, Flowers.
Alternatively, display the model by putting it into the head slot of an invisible Armor Stand.
faq.obj: Blockbench is a modeling program that is limited to boxes. Therefore it cannot import the usually far more complex OBJ models.
faq.java-sizelimit: Java block and item models are limited to this size by the format. To display those models larger in game, go to the display tab and use the scale slider to scale the model up. Then display it in the head or hand slot of an invisible armor stand in game.
faq.animation:
**Bedrock Edition:** Models can be animated using the animation tab in the top right corner
**Vanilla Java Edition:** Java block and item models don't support animations natively. There is a trick to use animated textures to simulate movement, but its options are fairly limited. This video explains this trick in depth: <https://youtu.be/9EXrHIBD_2E>
**OptiFine Entities:** Optifine entities support expression based animations. More info here: <https://github.com/sp614x/optifine/blob/master/OptiFineDoc/doc/cem_animation.txt>
**Modded entities:** Modded entities can be animated manually through code but not in your modeling program
**Free Models:** Models can be animated using the animation tab in the top right corner. The models can be exported along with animations using the export format glTF.
faq.bedrock-smallcubes: The size of cubes is floored for the UV map calculation. This means that any size smaller than 1 will result in a 0 pixel wide UV map, which will look glitchy. To prevent this make sure all of your cubes are at least 1 unit long in each direction. To create smaller cubes, use the Inflate slider.
faq.sketchfab-blur: To render textures pixelated in Sketchfab, go to the "3D Settings" of your model. Open the "Materials" tab and select your texture in the upper dropdown menu. In the "PBR Maps" section, click on the icon below "Base Color" and set "Filtering" to "Nearest". Save the settings and quit. Your textures will now display pixelated. Note that the size of textures must be a power of two to display correctly.
faq.default-pack:
Disclaimer: Use these packs as **REFERENCE**, don't put your models inside them, it just increases your pack needlessly and the distributions of default assets in your pack would be illegal.

**For Java Edition:** Go to `.minecraft/versions/1.14` and open the 1.14.jar in there with a zip program. Extract/copy the "assets" folder inside the jar somewhere. It contains all the default models/textures.
_(this works the same for all versions, 1.14 is just used as an example here)_

**For Bedrock Edition:** Go to <https://www.minecraft.net/en-us/addons> and look above the "installation instructions" for the download link for the default pack.
faq.bow-model:
```json
"overrides": [
        { "predicate": {"pulling": 1 }, "model": "item/bow_pulling_0" },
        { "predicate": {"pulling": 1, "pull": 0.65 }, "model": "item/bow_pulling_1" },
        { "predicate": {"pulling": 1, "pull": 0.9 }, "model": "item/bow_pulling_2" },

        { "predicate": { "custom_model_data": 1 }, "model": "custom/fire_bow" },
        { "predicate": { "custom_model_data": 1, "pulling": 1 }, "model": "custom/fire_bow_pulling0" },
        { "predicate": { "custom_model_data": 1, "pulling": 1, "pull": 0.65 }, "model": "custom/fire_bow_pulling1" },
        { "predicate": { "custom_model_data": 1, "pulling": 1, "pull": 0.9 }, "model": "custom/fire_bow_pulling2" }
]```
pulling = bow gets pulled (either 0 or 1)
pull = how much is the bow pulled in % (numbers from 0 to 1)

so you could also have more/less pull models if you want it smoother for example
faq.output-log: The output log will show you errors related to resource packs. Here is how you can enable it: https://i.imgur.com/aL8XRaq.png
faq.java-armor: The armor model when worn on players/entities cannot be remodeled in vanilla Java edition, only retextured. Pumpkins and other blocks set on a player's head *can* be remodeled for custom hats, but won't display if set on feet/legs/torso
faq.dontask: Don't ask to ask, just ask: https://sol.gfxile.net/dontask.html
faq.render-order: If you use semi-transparent textures (like colored glass) you need to move elements with that texture to the bottom of the element list. Otherwise elements behind these semi-transparent ones won't render ingame.
faq.json:
JSON is a popular data structure format that can be used for any type of data. The extension `.json` is therefore ambiguous and does not necessarily mean that the file is compatible with your needs. If you refer to JSON files without context, we won't know which one you are talking about.

Here are the most common JSON files in the context of Blockbench:
• Java Edition Block/Item Model (`.json`)
• Bedrock edition geometry (`.json`, often `.geo.json`)
• OptiFine model (`.jem` or `.jpm`)
• Blockbench Project File (`.bbmodel`)
• Blockbench Theme (`.bbtheme`)
faq.quickstart: Find out which Format, Help Channel and Tutorials you should use on https://blockbench.net/quickstart
faq.bugs: Feel free to report any bugs at <https://github.com/JannisX11/blockbench/issues>.
faq.content-log:
Content Log in Bedrock Edition helps you identify issues in resource and behavior packs. You can enable it here:
https://imgur.com/a/RSaukEP
faq.modded-limitations:
**Limitation List for Modded Entities**
●  Sizes cannot be smaller than 1
●  Decimal values like 1.3, 2.5, 1.8 do not work until Minecraft 1.15 (Blockbench cannot export it)
●  To bypass both limits above, you can use inflation. It scales a cubes by the given value on all 6 sides.
(A 2x2x2 cube with a -0.25 Inflation will become 1.5x1.5x1.5 large)
●  Saving is not the same as exporting, some information get's lost on export, so always save your models as a .bbmodel!
faq.crossbow-model:
```json
"overrides": [
  { "predicate": {"pulling": 1 }, "model": "item/crossbow_pulling_0" },
  { "predicate": {"pulling": 1, "pull": 0.58 }, "model": "item/crossbow_pulling_1" },
  { "predicate": {"pulling": 1, "pull": 1.0 }, "model": "item/crossbow_pulling_2" },      
  { "predicate": {"charged": 1 }, "model": "item/crossbow_arrow" },
  { "predicate": {"charged": 1, "firework": 1 }, "model": "item/crossbow_firework" },
  
  { "predicate": {"custom_mode_data": 1}, "model": "custom/big_crossbow" },
  { "predicate": {"custom_mode_data": 1, "pulling": 1 }, "model": "custom/big_crossbow_pulling_0" },
  { "predicate": {"custom_mode_data": 1, "pulling": 1, "pull": 0.58 }, "model": "custom/big_crossbow_pulling_1" },
  { "predicate": {"custom_mode_data": 1, "pulling": 1, "pull": 1.0 }, "model": "custom/big_crossbow_pulling_2" },      
  { "predicate": {"custom_mode_data": 1, "charged": 1 }, "model": "custom/big_crossbow_arrow" },
  { "predicate": {"custom_mode_data": 1, "charged": 1, "firework": 1 }, "model": "custom/big_crossbow_firework" }
]```
pulling = crossbow gets pulled (either 0 or 1)
pull = how much is the crossbow pulled in % (numbers from 0 to 1)
charged= crossbow was fully charged and has ammo loaded (either 0 or 1)
firework= crossbow has a firework loaded (either 0 or 1)

you could also have more/less pull models if you want it to look smoother for example
faq.masteriano-tips:
A list of quick tips about modeling and texturing by MasterianoX:
<https://blockbench.net/2019/10/02/minecraft-modeling-texturing-tips>
faq.box-uv:
Box UV is a UV mapping mode in which all sides of an element are stuck together (similar to a cut up dice) and their size depends on the dimensions of the cube. In comparison to per-face UV-mapping, individual faces cannot be mapped separately, and the size of the UV map cannot be changed individually.
Box UV is currently mandatory in the Modded Entity format and optional in all other formats. 

If you want to change the UV mode, go to File > Project and toggle "Box UV".
https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/549198394925514753/704210124306382928/unknown.png
faq.invalid-names:
Files/Folders nor reference to them are allowed to contain capital letters nor spaces. 
Valid symobls are: `a-z` (lowercase only!) `0-9` `/` `.` `_` and `-` 

When changing a file's/folder's name, keep in mind that you also need to update all references (texture path in models, model paths in custom_model_data predicates etc.)
